name: Idalia 108 Toro
additionalNotes:
I don't have a link for this one, but the notes that came with it from Privada Cigar Club say this:  "Blackbird Cigar Co, the company that brought us the Fast Eddie and the RIO now have a new cigar they have blessed us with. This is the pre-release version of that cigar. Only 10,000 were made and we have most of that stock. You should see this on shelves one day soon but the band will change. The cigar is named after the grandmother of the two brothers who started the company. She lived to be 108 years old and smoked at least one cigar every single day of her life! Stories like this are why I started the club. The cigar is a 6 x 54 box-pressed toro. The wrapper is Mexican San Andres over a Brazilian binder and Dominican and Nicaraguan fillers. The company says the Dominican tobaccos were grown by Jochy Blanco. The cap style is a hybrid of sorts. It's almost like a regular shaped cigar (Parejo), but it has characteristics of a belicoso."

Now in the PCC shop:
https://privadacigarclub.com/shop/blackbird-idalia-108-toro/
